sentences.english: I write because I want to clear some misconceptions about Yoon Eun Hye.
sentences.chinese: 我寫這席話，是因爲我想澄清一些關於尹恩惠的誤解。

sentences.english: Be shy of favours bestowed at the expense of others.
sentences.chinese: 享用借花獻佛的恩惠是要付出代價的。

sentences.english: Breeding drugs would be a medical boon .
sentences.chinese: 藥物繁育是醫藥學的一個恩惠。

sentences.english: Sanctity is the second benefit of the covenant of grace and flows from justification.
sentences.chinese: 成聖是恩典之約的第二個恩惠，它源於稱義。

sentences.english: Fortune reigns in gifts of the world, not in lineament of nature .
sentences.chinese: 命運之神是人世間恩惠的主宰，不能支配自然的相貌。

sentences.english: Sometimes one casual favour could turn out one eternal warmness in someone's heart.
sentences.chinese: 有時候，我們不經意的恩惠會永恆的溫暖某個人的心。

sentences.english: Stewardship of the natural world stands as an obligation of certain religious traditions.
sentences.chinese: 自然世界的職能在某些宗教傳統中代表了一種恩惠。

sentences.english: I hope the grace of God would descend on me.
These flowers are a small acknowledgement of your great kindness.
sentences.chinese: 這些花是用來對您的恩惠略表謝意的。

sentences.english: Grace be with you all. Amen.
sentences.chinese: 願恩惠常與你們衆人同在。

sentences.english: 8Now Stephen, a man full of God's grace and power, did great wonders and miraculous signs among the people.
sentences.chinese: 司提反滿得恩惠能力，在民間行了大奇事和神蹟。

sentences.english: Remenber what you receive from others, and forget benefits you confer to others.
sentences.chinese: 記住別人給你的好處，忘掉自己施人的恩惠。

sentences.english: With Her two right hands She offers boons and reassurance to Her devotees.
sentences.chinese: 她用兩隻右手對她的奉獻者給予恩惠和保證。

sentences.english: He craved a favor of the king.
It is evident that they have earned these material bounties with the utmost facility.
sentences.chinese: 很顯然，它們極其容易地就得到了這些物質的恩惠。

sentences.english: It's like for Paul the blessings of the eschaton, the eschatology,is still horizontal.
sentences.chinese: 就好像，保羅認爲的末世恩惠，世界末日仍在遠處。

definition: favor from an emperor or high official
favor/to give charity to sb out of pity
to confer a favor on sb/to confer a benefit
a benefactor/a person who has significantly helped sb else
special favor from a ruler/Emperor's generosity towards a favorite
to recall fondly/to remember with emotion
grateful and seeking to repay the kindness (idiom)
asylum/shelter/to shield/to put under protection/to take under one's wing
